snippet: Many people were surprised that the vote on same-sex marriage in North Carolina was so decisive, but the state’s political inconsistencies include a long tradition of social conservatism.
abstract: North Carolina voters' overwhelming decision to ban same-sex marriage belies fact that two thirds of the state's population supports some form of legal rights for same-sex couples; state's complex mix of social conservatism and economic populism make it an unpredictable force in the presidential election.

byline.contributor: Robbie Brown contributed reporting from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: Many people were surprised that the vote on same-sex marriage in North Carolina was so decisive, but the state’s political inconsistencies include a long tradition of social conservatism.

headline.seo: In North Carolina, Gay Rights Not a Simple Issue
headline.main: In North Carolina, Beliefs Clash on Marriage Law
headline.print_headline: An Issue of Gay Rights, but Not a Simple One

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
